alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:17PM MST until July 28 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 317 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over Nogales Mexico. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen with an additional inch possible as new storms move into the area. The Nogales Wash at Nogales rapidly jumped to 6 ft at 3 pm and was still rising. At 8 ft it begins impacting roads and bridges in the area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nogales. This includes the following Flash Flood Prone Locations... Nogales Wash at Doe St Bridge and Nogales Port of Entry Deconcini Crossing. This includes the following streams and drainages... Santa Cruz River and Potrero Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
